subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: {{cog|mkh-vie-pro|*k-ɟəːŋ||bed}}, whence {{cog|vi|giường}} and {{cog|scb|kəcɨːŋ²}}, is a borrowing from Old Chinese ({{zh-ref|Alves, 2015}}).

subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# [[bed]]; [[couch]] {{zh-mw|張}}
# [[framework]]; [[chassis]]
# {{lb|zh|Teochew}} [[table]]
# rails of the well
# [[bottom]]
# classifier for bedding, or large vehicles

subSections.title: Readings
Etymology 1
Noun
Etymology 2
Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|とこ}}

# a [[raised]] [[platform]] roughly 30cm tall used in dirt-floored rooms as a [[seat]]
# a raised area on which to sleep: a [[bed]]
# a [[sickbed]]
# the [[floor]]
# [[tatami]] mats
# the seat of an [[oxcart]]
# short for {{m|ja|床間}} / {{m|ja|床の間|tr=toko no ma}}: an [[alcove]] with a raised floor along one wall of a traditional Japanese living room
# an alcove with a raised floor used as a [[study]]: see {{m|ja|付書院|tr=tsuke shoin}}
# a [[box seat]], such as at a [[parade]], [[theater]], or [[stadium]]
# short for {{m|ja|床店|tr=tokomise}}: a [[stall]] with a raised floor used as a store
# short for {{m|ja|床屋|tr=tokoya}}: a [[barbershop]], from how such shops were historically often ''tokomise''
# short for {{m|ja|床船梁|tr=toko funabari}}, {{m|ja|舵床|tr=kajidoko}}: the large [[wooden]] [[beam]] at the very [[aft]] of a traditional [[wood]]-[[hulled]] Japanese [[ship]], upon which the [[rudder]] is seated
# the [[heel]] of a [[plough]]; the part of the bottom of a plough that touches the ground and guides the [[ploughshare]]
# short for {{m|ja|苗床|tr=naedoko}}: a [[seedbed]]
# short for {{m|ja|鉄床}}, {{m|ja|金床|tr=kanatoko}}: an [[anvil]]

subSections.title: Synonyms
subSections.text: * {{sense|sickbed}} {{ja-r|病床|びょうしょう}}, {{ja-r|病褥|びょうじょく}}

subSections.title: Etymology 3
